name: cloudamqp
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing CloudAMQP resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`cloudamqp` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cloudamqp/terraform-provider-cloudamqp).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing CloudAMQP resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cloudamqp/terraform-provider-cloudamqp)
> distributed under [MIT](https://mit-license.org/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-cloudamqp` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-cloudamqp/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-cloudamqp` repo](https://github.com/cloudamqp/terraform-provider-cloudamqp/issues).

apikey.description: Key used to authentication to the CloudAMQP Customer API

baseurl.description: Base URL to CloudAMQP Customer website

settings.description:
Array of one or more settings to be copied. Allowed values: [alarms, config, definitions, firewall, logs, metrics, plugins]

See more below, copy settings

subscriptionId.description: Instance identifier of the CloudAMQP instance to copy the settings from.

username.description:
Username of the responder

Responders of type `team`, `escalation` and `schedule` can use either id or name.
While `user` can use either id or username.

ip.description: CIDR address: IP address with CIDR notation (e.g. 10.56.72.0/24)

plan.description: The subscription plan used for the instance

region.description: The region were the instanece is located in
The region were the instanece is located in

tags.description: Tag the VPC instance with optional tags

vpcName.description: VPC name given when hosted at the cloud provider

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

provider.description:
The provider type for the cloudamqp package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apikey.description: Key used to authentication to the CloudAMQP Customer API

baseurl.description: Base URL to CloudAMQP Customer website

enableFasterInstanceDestroy.description: Skips destroying backend resources on 'terraform destroy'

baseurl.description: Base URL to CloudAMQP Customer website

enableFasterInstanceDestroy.description: Skips destroying backend resources on 'terraform destroy'

## Import

Not possible to import this resource.

action.description: The action to be invoked. Allowed actions `rotate-password`, `rotate-apikey`.
The action to be invoked. Allowed actions `rotate-password`, `rotate-apikey`.

action.description: The action to be invoked. Allowed actions `rotate-password`, `rotate-apikey`.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the alarm to trigger.

messageType.description:
Message type `(total, unacked, ready)` used by queue alarm type.

Specific argument for `disk` alarm

queueRegex.description: Regex for which queue to check.

recipients.description: Identifier for recipient to be notified. Leave empty to notify all recipients.

reminderInterval.description: The reminder interval (in seconds) to resend the alarm if not resolved. Set to 0 for no reminders. The Default is 0.

timeThreshold.description: The time interval (in seconds) the `value_threshold` should be active before triggering an alarm.

type.description: The alarm type, see valid options below.

valueCalculation.description:
Disk value threshold calculation, `fixed, percentage` of disk space remaining.

Based on alarm type, different arguments are flagged as required or optional.

valueThreshold.description: The value to trigger the alarm for.

vhostRegex.description: Regex for which vhost to check

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering CustomDomain resources.

allowDowntime.description: When resizing the disk, allow cluster downtime if necessary. Default set to false. Required when hosting in *Azure*.

extraDiskSize.description: Extra disk size in GB. Supported values: 0, 25, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000, 2000

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for resizing the disk. Default set to 30 seconds.

timeout.description:
Configurable timeout time in seconds for resizing the disk. Default set to 1800 seconds.

***Note:*** `allow_downtime`, `sleep`, `timeout` only available from v1.25.0.

allowDowntime.description: When resizing the disk, allow cluster downtime if necessary. Default set to false. Required when hosting in *Azure*.

extraDiskSize.description: Extra disk size in GB. Supported values: 0, 25, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000, 2000

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for resizing the disk. Default set to 30 seconds.

timeout.description:
Configurable timeout time in seconds for resizing the disk. Default set to 1800 seconds.

allowDowntime.description: When resizing the disk, allow cluster downtime if necessary. Default set to false. Required when hosting in *Azure*.

extraDiskSize.description: Extra disk size in GB. Supported values: 0, 25, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000, 2000

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for resizing the disk. Default set to 30 seconds.

***Note:*** `allow_downtime`, `sleep`, `timeout` only available from v1.25.0.

apikey.description: API key needed to communicate to CloudAMQP's second API. The second API is used to manage alarms, integration and more, full description [CloudAMQP API](https://docs.cloudamqp.com/cloudamqp_api.html).

backend.description: Information if the CloudAMQP instance runs either RabbitMQ or LavinMQ.

copySettings.description:
Copy settings from one CloudAMQP instance to a new. Consists of the block documented below.

___

The `copy_settings` block consists of:

dedicated.description: Information if the CloudAMQP instance is shared or dedicated.

host.description: The external hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.

hostInternal.description: The internal hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.

keepAssociatedVpc.description: Keep associated VPC when deleting instance, default set to false.

noDefaultAlarms.description: Set to true to discard creating default alarms when the instance is created. Can be left out, will then use default value = false.

nodes.description:
Number of nodes, 1, 3 or 5 depending on plan used. Only needed for legacy plans, will otherwise be computed.

***Deprecated: Legacy subscriptions plan can still change this to scale up or down the instance. New subscriptions plans use the plan to determine number of nodes. In order to change number of nodes the `plan` needs to be updated.***

plan.description: The subscription plan. See available plans

ready.description: Flag describing if the resource is ready

region.description:
The region to host the instance in. See instance regions

***Note: Changing region will force the instance to be destroyed and a new created in the new region. All data will be lost and a new name assigned.***

rmqVersion.description:
The Rabbit MQ version. Can be left out, will then be set to default value used by CloudAMQP API.

***Note: There is not yet any support in the provider to change the RMQ version. Once it's set in the initial creation, it will remain.***

tags.description: One or more tags for the CloudAMQP instance, makes it possible to categories multiple instances in console view. Default there is no tags assigned.

url.description: The AMQP URL (uses the internal hostname if the instance was created with VPC). Has the format: `amqps://{username}:{password}@{hostname}/{vhost}`

vhost.description: The virtual host used by Rabbit MQ.

vpcId.description: The VPC ID. Use this to create your instance in an existing VPC. See available example.

vpcSubnet.description:
Creates a dedicated VPC subnet, shouldn't overlap with other VPC subnet, default subnet used 10.56.72.0/24.

***Deprecated: Will be removed in next major version (v2.0)***

***Note: extra fee will be charged when using VPC, see [CloudAMQP](https://cloudamqp.com) for more information.***

awsAccountId.description: The 12 digit AWS Account ID where you want the events to be sent to.

awsRegion.description: The AWS region where you the events to be sent to. (e.g. us-west-1, us-west-2, ..., etc.)

queue.description: A (durable) queue on your RabbitMQ instance.

status.description: Always set to null, unless there is an error starting the EventBridge.

vhost.description: The VHost the queue resides in.

withHeaders.description: Include message headers in the event data.

vhost.description: The VHost the queue resides in.

withHeaders.description: Include message headers in the event data.

cloudamqp:index/integrationLog:Integrati.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage third party log integrations for a CloudAMQP instance.
Once configured, the logs produced will be forward to corresponding integration.

Only available for dedicated subscription plans.

## Integration Type reference

Valid arguments for third party log integrations. See more information at [docs.cloudamqp.com](https://docs.cloudamqp.com/cloudamqp_api.html#add-log-integration)

Required arguments for all integrations: name

| Integration | name | Required arguments |
| ---- | ---- | ---- |
| Azure monitor | azure_monitor | tenant_id, application_id, application_secret, dce_uri, table, dcr_id |
| CloudWatch | cloudwatchlog | access_key_id, secret_access_key, region |
| Coralogix | coralogix | private_key, endpoint, application, subsystem |
| Data Dog | datadog | region, api_keys, tags |
| Log Entries | logentries | token |
| Loggly | loggly | token |
| Papertrail | papertrail | url |
| Scalyr | scalyr | token, host |
| Splunk | splunk | token, host_port, sourcetype |
| Stackdriver | stackdriver | credentials |

***Note:*** Stackdriver (v1.20.2 or earlier versions) required arguments  : project_id, private_key, client_email

## Dependency

This resource depends on CloudAMQP instance identifier, `cloudamqp_instance.instance.id`.


## Import

`cloudamqp_integration_log`can be imported using the resource identifier together with CloudAMQP instance identifier. The name and identifier are CSV separated, see example below.

 ```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudamqp:index/integrationLog:IntegrationLog <resource_name> <id>,<instance_id>`
```

applicationId.description: The application identifier for Azure monitor.

applicationSecret.description: The application secret for Azure monitor.

clientEmail.description: The client email registered for the integration service.

credentials.description: Google Service Account private key credentials.

dceUri.description: The data collection endpoint for Azure monitor.

dcrId.description:
ID of data collection rule that your DCE is linked to for Azure Monitor.

This is the full list of all arguments. Only a subset of arguments are used based on which type of integration used. See Integration Type reference table below for more information.

endpoint.description: The syslog destination to send the logs to for Coralogix.

host.description: The host for Scalyr integration. (app.scalyr.com, app.eu.scalyr.com)

instanceId.description: Instance identifier used to make proxy calls

name.description:
The name of the third party log integration. See
Integration type reference

sourcetype.description: Assign source type to the data exported, eg. generic_single_line. (Splunk)

table.description: The table name for Azure monitor.

tenantId.description: The tenant identifier for Azure monitor.

applicationId.description: The application identifier for Azure monitor.

applicationSecret.description: The application secret for Azure monitor.

clientEmail.description: The client email registered for the integration service.

credentials.description: Google Service Account private key credentials.

dceUri.description: The data collection endpoint for Azure monitor.

dcrId.description:
ID of data collection rule that your DCE is linked to for Azure Monitor.

This is the full list of all arguments. Only a subset of arguments are used based on which type of integration used. See Integration Type reference table below for more information.

endpoint.description: The syslog destination to send the logs to for Coralogix.

host.description: The host for Scalyr integration. (app.scalyr.com, app.eu.scalyr.com)

instanceId.description: Instance identifier used to make proxy calls

name.description:
The name of the third party log integration. See
Integration type reference

sourcetype.description: Assign source type to the data exported, eg. generic_single_line. (Splunk)

table.description: The table name for Azure monitor.

tenantId.description: The tenant identifier for Azure monitor.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering IntegrationLog resources.

applicationId.description: The application identifier for Azure monitor.

applicationSecret.description: The application secret for Azure monitor.

credentials.description: Google Service Account private key credentials.

This is the full list of all arguments. Only a subset of arguments are used based on which type of integration used. See Integration Type reference table below for more information.

apiKey.description: The API key for the integration service. (Librato)

email.description: The email address registred for the integration service. (Librato)

iamExternalId.description: External identifier that match the role you created. (Cloudwatch)

iamRole.description: The ARN of the role to be assumed when publishing metrics. (Cloudwatch)

licenseKey.description: The license key registred for the integration service. (New Relic)

region.description: AWS region for Cloudwatch and [US/EU] for Data dog/New relic. (Cloudwatch, Data Dog, New Relic)

cloudamqp:index/plugin:Plugin.description:
## Import

`cloudamqp_plugin` can be imported using the name argument of the resource together with CloudAMQP instance identifier. The name and identifier are CSV separated, see example below.

 ```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudamqp:index/plugin:Plugin rabbitmq_management rabbitmq_management,<instance_id>`
```

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

## Import

`cloudamqp_plugin` can be imported using the name argument of the resource together with CloudAMQP

 instance identifier. The name and identifier are CSV separated, see example below.

 ```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudamqp:index/pluginCommunity:PluginCommunity <resource_name> <plugin_name>,<instance_id>`
```

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for plugins

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for plugins

activeZones.description: Covering availability zones used when creating an Endpoint from other VPC.

allowedPrincipals.description: Allowed principals to access the endpoint service.

serviceName.description: Service name of the PrivateLink used when creating the endpoint from other VPC.

sleep.description:
Configurable sleep time (seconds) when enable PrivateLink.
Default set to 10 seconds. *Available from v1.29.0*

timeout.description:
Configurable timeout time (seconds) when enable PrivateLink. Default set to 1800 seconds. *Available from v1.29.0* Allowed principals format:
`arn:aws:iam::aws-account-id:root`
`arn:aws:iam::aws-account-id:user/user-name`
`arn:aws:iam::aws-account-id:role/role-name`

approvedSubscriptions.description:
Approved subscriptions to access the endpoint service.
See format below.

serverName.description: Name of the server having the PrivateLink enabled.

serviceName.description: Service name (alias) of the PrivateLink, needed when creating the endpoint.

sleep.description:
Configurable sleep time (seconds) when enable PrivateLink.
Default set to 10 seconds. *Available from v1.29.0*

timeout.description:
Configurable timeout time (seconds) when enable PrivateLink. Default set to 1800 seconds. *Available from v1.29.0* Approved subscriptions format (GUID):
`XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX`

Configurable sleep time (seconds) when enable PrivateLink.
Default set to 10 seconds. *Available from v1.29.0*

`XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX`

Default set to 10 seconds. *Available from v1.29.0*

timeout.description:
Configurable timeout time (seconds) when enable PrivateLink. Default set to 1800 seconds. *Available from v1.29.0* Approved subscriptions format (GUID):
`XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX`

cloudamqp:index/rabbitConfiguration:Rabb.description:
## Import

`cloudamqp_rabbitmq_configuration` can be imported using the CloudAMQP instance identifier.

 ```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudamqp:index/rabbitConfiguration:RabbitConfiguration config <instance_id>`
```

channelMax.description: Set the maximum permissible number of channels per connection.

clusterPartitionHandling.description: Set how the cluster should handle network partition.

connectionMax.description: Set the maximum permissible number of connection.

consumerTimeout.description: A consumer that has recevied a message and does not acknowledge that message within the timeout in milliseconds

heartbeat.description: Set the server AMQP 0-9-1 heartbeat timeout in seconds.

logExchangeLevel.description:
Log level for the logger used for log integrations and the CloudAMQP Console log view.

*Note: Requires a restart of RabbitMQ to be applied.*

maxMessageSize.description: The largest allowed message payload size in bytes.

queueIndexEmbedMsgsBelow.description: Size in bytes below which to embed messages in the queue index. 0 will turn off payload embedding in the queue index.

sleep.description: Configurable sleep time in seconds between retries for RabbitMQ configuration. Default set to 60 seconds.

timeout.description: Configurable timeout time in seconds for RabbitMQ configuration. Default set to 3600 seconds.

vmMemoryHighWatermark.description: When the server will enter memory based flow-control as relative to the maximum available memory.

cloudamqp:index/getInstance:getInstance.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about an already created CloudAMQP instance. In order to retrieve the correct information, the CoudAMQP instance identifier is needed.

## Attributes reference

All attributes reference are computed

* `id`          - The identifier for this resource.
* `name`        - The name of the CloudAMQP instance.
* `plan`        - The subscription plan for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `region`      - The cloud platform and region that host the CloudAMQP instance, `{platform}::{region}`.
* `vpc_id`      - ID of the VPC configured for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `vpc_subnet`  - Dedicated VPC subnet configured for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `nodes`       - Number of nodes in the cluster of the CloudAMQP instance.
* `rmq_version` - The version of installed Rabbit MQ.
* `url`         - (Sensitive) The AMQP URL (uses the internal hostname if the instance was created with VPC), used by clients to connect for pub/sub.
* `apikey`      - (Sensitive) The API key to secondary API handing alarms, integration etc.
* `tags`        - Tags the CloudAMQP instance with categories.
* `host`        - The external hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `host_internal` - The internal hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.
* `vhost`       - The virtual host configured in Rabbit MQ.
* `dedicated`   - Information if the CloudAMQP instance is shared or dedicated.
* `backend`     - Information if the CloudAMQP instance runs either RabbitMQ or LavinMQ.
